pageContext.description:
A half-length portrait of Philipp Melanchthon, signed and dated. The painting corresponds with a portrait type, which was reproduced numerous times in the Cranach workshop from 1532. Further examples of the same format are preserved in Berlin, Dresden, Regensburg and Munich. The scholar and reformer is shown in three quarter profile against a monochrome blue background, facing to his right. He is wearing an academic gown and his hands are folded.
[cda 2020]
